thread.title: Just ducky: Wet, splashy conditions for runners in Camden Hills Invitational
thread.title_full: Just ducky: Wet, splashy conditions for runners in Camden Hills Invitational

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Ken Waltz)
title: Just ducky: Wet, splashy conditions for runners in Camden Hills Invitational
text:
Just ducky: Wet, splashy conditions for runners in Camden Hills Invitational Brunswick distance athletes finish atop rain-soaked pack By Ken Waltz | Oct 09, 2015 Photo by: Mark Haskell 
Rockport â€” In miserable weather better suited for ducks or any water-loving creature, there was no singing in the rain for the dozens of high school cross-country runners who braved tough conditions to participate in the annual Camden Hills Invitational on Friday afternoon, Oct. 9. 
While no singing was heard, there were plenty of youngsters who stepped into mud puddles on the slick, rain-saturated course, which is unique because it finishes with a lap around the track in front of the bleachers. 
Plenty of colorful umbrellas were out among fans in the dreary weather for Camden Hills' homecoming weekend event. 
Besides host Camden Hills, Oceanside of Rockland/Thomaston, Lincoln Academy of Newcastle, Medomak Valley of Waldoboro, Belfast, Brunswick and Morse of Bath participated. 
A pair of Brunswick runners finished first in the boys and girls races over the sloppy course. The team results were unavailable. 
Complete results from the meet, along with a link to more photos, will appear later with this story. Included here are photos from the event. (Photo by: Mark Haskell)
